hints.content: To divide a shape in thirds, we divide the whole into **$3$ equal parts**.

These rectangles are divided into $3$ pieces, but the pieces are not equal in size: 
 
![A rectangle has 2 horizontal lines dividing it into 3 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/de164ee2744f84c486a47fcbb912a28756a70bd4)

![A rectangle has 2 vertical lines dividing it into 3 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0ad575f2c28c6752684a1b7a508a29e7ea3f4792)

These rectangles are divided into thirds:  

![A rectangle has 2 horizontal lines dividing it into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9dcbc6ee99337b11d73322d5a0bf7da708df199d)

![A rectangle has 2 vertical lines dividing it into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6c7c79c233561958b6e84091449ec41d5999f27b)

question.content:
**Which rectangles are divided into thirds?**
